text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the fire report being 'sufficient and suitable' is the responsibility of the owner even if the report was incorrectly completed by the third-party inspector. The candidate answer explicitly addresses this under Section 1, 'Fire Risk Assessment Adequacy,' stating: 'The assessor's failure doesn't automatically absolve you of responsibility' and 'You may be liable for the assessor's negligence if you didn't verify their competence.' This directly covers the core concept of the owner's ultimate responsibility for the adequacy of the assessment.", "criterion_id": "96af97b1-4044-42bb-9b71-15102a04a27e"}
